{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3531080,"name":"Mikiyas Asmamaw","username":"MikiA30","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T03:24:28.194Z","cooked":"

As the title insists, we‚Äôre having trouble with out radio. I believe it is the vh-109 FRC radio model. It stopped working randomly after months of working fine. We thought it might‚Äôve shorted but it still turns on so that might not be it. It turns on but wont transmit wifi so we can‚Äôt connect to it and actually run the robot. We‚Äôve tried going into the network assistant tool to configure it but it won‚Äôt connect through that either. It detects the ethernet cable but won‚Äôt let us reconfigure it. It‚Äôs basically a black box with just led‚Äôs now, basically has no use. Without it we won‚Äôt be able to compete. I couldn‚Äôt find a factory reset button either to start from scratch. We‚Äôve tried going into the command prompt and doing ‚Äúipconfig‚Äù. The IP address on there won‚Äôt load when we put it into the browser. Actually, nothing will load in the browser while we have the ethernet connected . We‚Äôve tried pretty much everything from the vivid hosting website. When we search up http://radio.local/ nothing comes up, just says ‚Äúcan‚Äôt get to this site‚Äù Anyone ever face this issue?? Thanks!

Did your team update the radio firmware? There is a known memory corruption bug that can occur if you don‚Äôt update the firmware from the version shipped in the Kit of Parts.

Details are on this blog post here.

community.firstinspires.org

Important Radio Firmware Update

Learn more about an important firmware update for the new VH-109 Radios.

If that doesn‚Äôt seem to describe the issue your having, can you check what Status lights are lit up, and if any of them are blinking?

Sounds like your radio is stuck in the bootloader.
You‚Äôll need to reach out to support to get this resolved.
https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/support
